attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, for GNU/Linux 2.6.9, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is a backdoor that establishes persistence by creating init.d scripts (`/etc/init.d/%s`, `/etc/rc%d.d/S90%s`) and a cron job at `/etc/cron.hourly/gcc.sh`, which it modifies to run every 3 minutes. It gathers extensive system information from `/proc` (cpuinfo, meminfo, net/tcp, osrelease) for fingerprinting. The malware communicates over HTTP, using POST/GET requests and a fake Windows User-Agent string for C2 communications. It also executes suspicious shell commands, including enabling all network interfaces and copying `/lib/libudev.so` to `/lib/libudev.so.6`, indicating potential for rootkit-like behavior.
